did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Balloon: a Poetical Comedy in Three Acts circa 1920
did.abstract: Carbon typescript of Balloon, a Poetical Comedy in Three Acts. The first page contains the holographic inscription: "Early version of Balloon, my own typing. For the Thomas Wood Stevens Collection, a tribute to a valued friendship, Padraic Colum." The play is set at the Dadaelus Hotel in Nagalapolis, changed to Megalapolis in the published version, and is a satire of industrial society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Carbon typescript of Balloon, a Poetical Comedy in Three Acts. The first page contains the holographic inscription: "Early version of Balloon, my own typing. For the Thomas Wood Stevens Collection, a tribute to a valued friendship, Padraic Colum." The play is set at the Dadaelus Hotel in Nagalapolis, changed to Megalapolis in the published version, and is a satire of industrial society.
Bound in agent's folio: Samuel French Plays, New York.

relatedmaterial.p: Later version was published by Macmillan Company, 1929, and retitled: Balloon, a Comedy in Four Acts.
